page.title: 01GENERAL OVERVIEW
page.content: { Wymondham}is a friendly, active town, with a fascinating historical background. Today it has a well established commercial life, thriving industrial estates and well over a hundred active social organisations, many with international connections. The seat of Kett's Rebellion in 1549 it takes a pride in being a self contained community and is keen to conserve its independence, especially as its population increases from a present 10,000 to 14,000 in 10 years time. The town still retains much of its historic character including a market function for the surrounding villages and provides a venue for traditional fairs and carnivals. There are road,bus and rail links to Norwich Cambridge and London,two hotels and a number of historic inns.
